channel.title: [WinXP]User account tweaker V3 (Now with batch file creator)
channel.description:
[b]Update VERSION 3!!:[/b] 1. Added add/delete accounts through main menu 2. Has a batch file creator (only use if your on XP SP2). Be sure you read the readme, it explains tha batch creator better. [url=http://rapidshare.de/files/32690265/AccountTweakerV3.zip.html]http://rapidshare.de/files/32690265/AccountTweakerV3.zip.html[/url] [b]Previous Versions:[/b]
[b]UPDATE V2:[/b] 1. I now added a main menu. From that menu, you can choose to promote/demote accounts, or change account passwords. 2. If using promote/demote function, you can hide your account from the other admins. Download: [url=http://rapidshare.de/files/30662544/UserAccountTweakerV2.zip.html]http://rapidshare.de/files/30662544/UserAccountTweakerV2.zip.html[/url]
[b]User Account Promoter/demoter V1[/b] This is pretty simple. I don't need to give you instructions, it pretty much just explains itself. It's written in C++, because I'm sure someone will ask. Before anyone asks, I'm pretty sure it wont work on WinXP SP2 (unless you are already an admin), if you're not an admin it just works on SP1 and no SP. The good thing is, most schools, libraries etc. have WinXP SP1. So I'm basically saying this probably wont work on your home computer. If I come acrossed a way, I will add it into the program. It's also funny to demote your school's admin into a guest (I havn't really tried this, so don't get your hopes up). I would recommend putting this thing on a floppy (yes, it can fit) along with your homework and use it when no ones looking. I got the idea from this tutorial: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,4135.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,4135.0.html[/url] And I decided it would be a great way for me to practice C++, and may be helpful to some people. Enjoy! :) Btw, be sure you extract it (don't run it from inside the .zip).

item.title: [WinXP]User account tweaker V3 (Now with batch file creator)
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

mvp566:

ok heres what my problom is i log into a account called CYSuser and download the account tweaker and i make an account called CYStest and i make it an admin and the tweaker says it works so i log of CYSuser and try to get onto CYStest and the account doesent work so i log back into CYSuser and the tweaker is gone…

Does the admin on your computer have some 3rd party security tools?

Read full topic

item.title: [WinXP]User account tweaker V3 (Now with batch file creator)
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“afi, post:60, topic:8969”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=12787.msg234507#msg234507 date=1157964625]

You will need to be an admin for this to work if you are running on SP2. That’s why I made this for school use, because they usually use SP1.

Don’t worry, I’m still working on the batch file creator, so you can just make a batch and get the admin to run it.

Hmm do you think you can make it compatiable for SP2?

I’m not sure if I can make the program itself SP2 compatible. I am about 30 minutes away from finishing the batch creator. When that’s finished, it wont matter what version of WinXP you are running, as long as you can get the admin to run the batch file.
[/quote]
Just leme know when your done =D[/quote]
Check the first post and have fun.

Be sure you read the readme first.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

afi:

System 5 Error.

Could you please post the ENTIRE error message? I have no idea what “System 5 Error” means.

I am getting ready to update it again. It will have a few more features, including a batch file creator. So if it just says “access is denied”, you could use it to create a batch file (one that will say it’s a Norton update or something), and get the admin to run it.
